definition: hide-and-seek (game)/peekaboo (game)
to hide/to dodge/to avoid
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem

sentences.english: Why don't violists play hide and seek?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中提琴手不玩躲貓貓？

sentences.english: Adam and Eve played the first game of hide and seek.
sentences.chinese: 亞當和夏娃是“躲貓貓”遊戲的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Reading was my favorite activity, closely followed by “playing pretend” outside.
sentences.chinese: 讀書是我的最愛，緊緊排在戶外“躲貓貓遊戲”之後。

sentences.english: So there's no reason to run and hide yet.
sentences.chinese: 所以還沒有理由躲貓貓。

sentences.english: How do you defeat the hiding syndrome? Here are some thoughts
sentences.chinese: 你該如何戰勝躲貓貓綜合症？

sentences.english: Nothing defeats hiding like seeking God together.
sentences.chinese: 若非一起尋求神，就沒人能戰勝躲貓貓綜合症。

sentences.english: There is a peek-a-boo community, whose head has not been found yet.
sentences.chinese: 有一個躲貓貓社團，他們的團長現在還沒找到。

sentences.english: When women were babies, they enjoyed playing peek-a-boo with their fathers.
sentences.chinese: 在女人年幼時，她們很喜歡和父親玩躲貓貓的遊戲。

sentences.english: My cousins and I usually played it just before dark.
sentences.chinese: 我和我表弟們經常玩躲貓貓到天黑才罷休。

sentences.english: He wants you and your mate hiding from one another.
sentences.chinese: 他正希望你倆互相躲貓貓呢。
